intro: Angianthus phyllocephalus, commonly known as the golden cupflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
